newsitem.title: USA: Neil Young cuts finger, postpones Europe tour.
newsitem.headline: Neil Young cuts finger, postpones Europe tour.

text.p: Folk rocker Neil Young pulled out of a European tour on Friday after cutting his finger, the second rock icon this week to cancel appearances in Europe.
The Canadian-born Young, 51, was forced to pull out of the tour after cutting his left index finger slicing a ham sandwich a few days ago, his publicist Bob Merlis said.
Legendary singer-songwriter Bob Dylan called off a European tour this week because of an infection that a source close to his family said produced swelling around his heart.
Young's doctor ordered him to put his guitar aside so the cut can heal properly, Merlis, of Reprise Records, said.
Young and his band, Crazy Horse, were set to start a 16-country tour on June 9. Merlis said Young was expected to heal in time for the North American H.O.R.D.E tour, which starts in mid-July.
"He should be able to make that as long as he follows doctor's orders," Merlis said. Organizers hope to reschedule the European tour in the fall.
